title: CFPB is investigating Goldman Sachs's credit-card practices; The bank said regulators are looking at areas including how it handles customer refunds
text:
A Goldman spokesman said the bank is cooperating with the investigation.

Credit-card lending is a key part of the bank's plan to grow its consumer finance arm, which launched about six years ago. Goldman expects the consumer bank to top $4 billion in annual revenue by 2024, roughly double what it is on pace to bring in this year.

Goldman launched its credit card business via a partnership with Apple Inc. AAPL in 2019. It also offers cards in partnership with General Motors Co. GM, and CEO David Solomon said last month on an investor call that Goldman is looking for opportunities to add more.

CFPB is investigating Goldman Sachs's credit-card practices
